column1: The eternal gates terrific porter lifted the northern bar:   Thel enter'd in & saw the secrets of the land unknown;   She saw the couches of the dead, & where the fibrous roots   Of every heart on earth infixes deep its restless twists:   A land of sorrows & of tears where never smile was seen.

column64: The Clod of Clay heard the Worms voice & rais'd her pitying head:   She bowd over the weeping infant, and her life exhald   In milky fondness, then on Thel she fix'd her humble eyes;   O beauty of the vales of Har, we live not for ourselves,   Thou seest me the meanest thing, and so I am indeed:   My bosom of itself is cold, and of itself is dark,   But he that loves the lowly, pours his oil upon my head   And kisses me, and binds his nuptial bands around my breast.
